column4: hellow quick question, i might be getting company laptop to use, but wanted to put ubuntu on it, can i do this and then revert it back to original wen i have to return it?
dualboot and then put it back (you'll need to be able to fix the MBR)
you'll want to backup the MBR (with Smart Boot Manager, perhaps) if you don't have any other method of restoring it
Smart boot manager (when you boot it from a floppy/whatever) can make a backup of the MBR, and can restore said backup as well
or, if you have *any* windows disc, you can do it there as well (and there's probably other utilities that do the same)
Yes.  The only difference is that it runs on NTFS.
does that mean it will be slighly slower aswell?
Its only slower when it comes to disk access.  And even then, only slightly.
